intro: Guilielma mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Brazilian state of Mato Grosso. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces small, clustered fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
